headline: Sports gaming startup Underdog bolsters C-suite days after event contracts launch
summary: (Reuters) -Sports gaming company Underdog said on Tuesday it has hired new finance and marketing chiefs, bolstering its leadership days after it rolled out event contracts for wagering on sporting leagues.  The company, which offers fantasy sports games and licensed sports betting, has appointed Rishi Garg as its chief financial officer.  Kimberly Pointer Corbett — previously a senior executive at Warner Bros Games, a part of Warner Bros Discovery — has been appointed as Underdog's new chief marketing officer.

Kimberly Pointer Corbett — previously a senior executive at Warner Bros Games, a part of Warner Bros Discovery — has been appointed as Underdog's new chief marketing officer.

headline: Is Robinhood Still Worth the Hype After Massive 2025 Rally and New BofA Price Target?
summary: So, you’re standing at the edge of a decision: hold on to your Robinhood Markets stock, grab more, or take some profits off the table? You’re not alone. This is one of the most talked-about names in fintech, and for good reason. Over the last year alone, Robinhood’s share price has soared a jaw-dropping 417.0%, and so far in 2025, the stock boasts an astonishing 191.2% gain year to date. Sure, the last week was down by 2.1%, but zoom out and the growth story becomes clear. A 1019.2% return in...
